description.narrative: Demonstration effect: The Project will have a significant demonstration effect by establishing viability of green buildings in Vietnam. TMG is committed to having a number of its projects meet IFC''s Green Building Standards, thereby demonstrating that it is possible to adopt energy and water conservation measures in the hotel sector. Improve tourism infrastructure: The use of proceeds will primarily be used for the development of three and four star hotels, which will increase much needed supply for hotel rooms in this category, thereby increasing private sector lead improvements in the tourist infrastructure. Employment creation and local linkage: The Project will create a number of direct and indirect jobs, as well as demand for locally sourced materials, services and labour, for the local economy. Foreign exchange and tax generation: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow, as a significant of TMG''s hotel guests are foreign nationals.

Thien Minh Group (TMG or Company) is one of the largest private sector integrated tour and hotel operator companies in Vietnam. In 2010, IFC made its first investment of US$12 million in a convertible loan to fund part of the Companys acquisition costs of the Victoria hotel chain in Vietnam. TMG is undertaking a long term strategic plan to expand both the tour and the hotel business by: (i) developing a branded three star hotel chain across major cities in Vietnam; (ii) scaling up the four-star Victoria hotel chain to major cities and tourist destinations in Vietnam; and (iii) diversifying its tour product portfolio by adding additional services. The proposed project is to provide equity financing to TMG to fund its new projects.
